items.content_html:
Description

When another element than the first focusable element should receive focus, it should be given the autofocus attribute.
see WICG/webcomponents#977

Motivation

Hmm. Make MDN docs better I guess?

Additional details

It currently doesn't work in Chrome, but I didn't think this info belonged on MDN docs. https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1399465
items.title: add autofocus info

items.content_html:
Description

This PR adds a note to the webextensions CSP documentation about the AMO policy which restricts remote CSP in Firefox addons (during the addons review process).
https://extensionworkshop.com/documentation/publish/add-on-policies/#development-practices
https://extensionworkshop.com/documentation/develop/build-a-secure-extension/

Motivation

Reviewers check addons for external/remote locations in the manifest csp field, and reject if it is present.

Adding this note in the MDN documentation makes developers aware of this policy in the docs, and may save both addon developers and reviewers time.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

#20437
items.title: webextensions csp: note about AMO remote csp policy

items.content_html:
Description

This page contains some very confusing concepts. For example, it says "a function declaration inside a block is a function expression" is plain wrong. It also includes unnecessary details about function definition syntaxes, which is repeated from their own reference pages. It makes no mention of async functions and async generator functions, which are post-ES6. This PR cuts back a lot of redundant text in this page so that it appears more overview-y.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Clean up the functions reference page

items.content_html:
Description

This PR documents the Web App Launch Handler API. See my research document for more information on what the overall work looks like: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Y-aFK0nVbEkdfaB5NkihKS5JhcKNrff2iWsWSTh2kas/edit#

I had a few asks/questions:

  • Because it is "the MDN way" to document everything completely, I have documented all the different parts of the API in the chain represented by window.launchQueue.setConsumer((launchParams) => { ... }) in their own pages. I'm hoping this doesn't make things too confusing, but let me know what you think.
  • I've largely explained what this API does in the context of implementing custom launch navigation handling functionality, as this is what seems to be the main crux to me, but I'm not 100% sure if that is appropriate.
  • Why are the array objects returned by LaunchParams.files FileSystemHandles, and not FileSystemFileHandles? You canâ€™t do much of use with just the features available on the parent class, surely.

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add docs for web app launch handler api

items.content_html:
Description

Associativity added for function call, computed member access and arrow operator.

Motivation

The associativity of these operators is listed as "n/a", while they clearly have a particular associativity:

  • Function calls like f(g)(2) and computed member access like [1,[2,3]][1][0] associate left-to-right.
  • The arrow operator (like a => b => b ) associates right-to-left.

Even though the opposite would grammatically not be possible, it makes sense and is helpful to list this associativity.

This is also in line with the assignment operators, which are listed as right-to-left, even though the opposite would grammatically not be possible.
items.title: Function call and arrow operator associativity

items.content_html:
Description

This PR adds the necessary documentation for the VirtualKeyboard API.

Motivation

The VirtualKeyboard API shipped in chromium-based browsers over a year ago (here is the CL where it got enabled).

It then was documented on BCD (here) which means that it's available on caniuse (here). And it was documented by Thomas Steiner on developer.chrome.com (here).

Although this is still only in Chromium-based browsers (mozilla position, webkit position), it's very useful on mobile devices and can be used as a progressive enhancement on supporting browsers. I think this API should absolutely be documented on MDN.
items.title: Documentation for the VirtualKeyboard API

items.content_html:
Description

I updated the <input> article to use the htmlattrdef macro, and updated references to use htmlattrxref.
I fixed some related typos as well: 60af577, 088cb4b, 7f9ab37, 3c3db63.

Motivation

I noticed a broken link, which led me to the cause (not using htmlattrdef) and to other instances (of links matching a[href^="/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#attr-"]).

Additional details

Unprefixed links still work, as the <dt>'s id has the attribute name in unprefixed form.

Related issues and pull requests

None, as far as I know.
items.title: Use htmlattr macros

items.content_html:
This updates the web API page templates to only mention the tags that are used for things in Web API - e.g. experimental, reference etc.

This is therefore a test/confirmation that the right set of items to remove/keep has been identified for Web APIs.

This is part of the tag removal project: mdn/mdn#262
items.title: Web API Templates - cut back to only required tags

items.content_html:
This PR rewrite the roles based on internal discussions.

In addition:

  • 'Spotlight contributor' has been moved to 'Specialized roles' because it does not sit well with other 'Roles'. One idea is to change the title 'Specialized roles' to 'Special roles' so that it can include spotlight contributor, invited expert, and community manager better.

TO DOs:

  • "Processes" sections need to be redone based on actual steps
  • What info should be retained from Volunteer and partner maintainers? Should we use the term 'partner maintainer' or is 'maintainer' good enough?
  • Add link to pull request guidelines if they are finalized before landing this
  • Add discord info for contacting the MDN team
  • File name to be updated: users_teams --> roles_teams
  • Sidebar to be updated
  • CONTRIBUTOR_ROLES.md to be removed
items.title: chore(meta): Updates roles and nomination processes
